page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT-UNEMPLOYMENT.
page.content: Over recent years the rate of unemployment has steadily increased due to trade depression. Greenock was once a hive of industry with its sugar factories, textile mills and shipbuilding yards. Most of these have gone. Many adults and school leavers are out of work. In the East End the situation is worst due to the dependence there on shipbuilding. Labour relations in Greenock have become increasingly strained with strikes at Scott Lithgow due to threatened redundancies and a "sit-in" at Lee's Jeans Factory due to a threatened closure. There is a feeling of mistrust between the management and workers at Scott Lithgow fuelled by the takeover by Trafalgar house and the fear of redundancies. It will be many years before this bridge between workers and employers is closed.
